Authors:
Digvijayini Bundhun, Rajesh JEEWON, Indunil Chinthani
Senanayake, Erio Camporesi, Janith Vishvakeerthi Aluthmuhandiram, Alvin
M. C. Tang, Ji-Chuan KANG, Vishwakalyan Bhoyroo, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Molecular phylogenetics of Discosia ravennica sp. nov. and a
new host record for Sporocadus rosigena
Keywords:
Amphisphaeriales, DNA sequences, new species, saprobes,
taxonomy
Abstract:
Collections of two dead leaf specimens from Italy were
subjected to morphological examination. Two coelomycetous taxa belonging
to two different genera in Xylariomycetidae, Sordariomycetes, namely
Discosia and Sporocadus, were identified. Multi-locus phylogeny based on
DNA sequence data of the large subunit (LSU) and internal transcribed
spacer (ITS) of nuclear ribosomal RNA genes and β-tubulin (β-tub2)
revealed that the Discosia species was basal to D. neofraxinea and
formed an independent lineage. The latter is also different from other
Discosia species by its unilocular to bilocular, superficial and
applanate conidiomata along with elongate-ampulliform conidiogenous
cells attenuated at the base, and conidia smaller in size. It is
introduced as Discosia ravennica sp. nov.. Morphological observations
coupled with multigene phylogeny identified our second taxon as
Sporocadus rosigena, which is herein described as a new record from
Italy. Descriptions, illustrations and molecular data for both species
are provided in this paper.
